paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant Tyr114Cys, including penetrance data and individual case details.

patients.phenotype: CNS symptoms such as cerebral amyloid angiopathy and cerebral hemorrhage, and systemic symptoms like gastrointestinal dysfunction.

individual_records.phenotype_details: CNS symptoms including fluctuating consciousness and rapid progressive dementia.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patients with ATTR Tyr114Cys amyloidosis exhibit initial symptoms in their thirties with a life expectancy of about 10 years after onset of the disease.

individual_records.phenotype_details: CNS symptoms including transient ischemic attack and extrapyramidal signs.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patients exhibited the typical CNS symptoms of ATTR Tyr114Cys amyloidosis, such as, cerebral amyloid angiopathy and cerebral hemorrhage.

functional_data.summary: The study generated and characterized heterozygous ATTR Tyr114Cys amyloidosis-specific iPS cells, which were differentiated into hepatocyte-like cells producing TTR protein.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the two reported patients.
variants.evidence_level: strong evidence based on clinical presentation and functional studies.
variants.additional_notes: The study emphasizes the need for further elucidation of the molecular pathogenesis of heterozygous ATTR Tyr114Cys amyloidosis.
key_quotes: Heterozygous ATTR Tyr114Cys (p.Tyr134Cys) amyloidosis is a lethal disease with a life expectancy of about 10 years after onset of the disease.
The pathogenesis of ATTR Tyr114Cys amyloidosis is still largely unknown.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the TTR variant Tyr114Cys was successfully extracted.
